intro: Lamourouxia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered lamourouxia, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
